channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A Florida activist creates safe spaces as laws and rhetoric turn against trans rights
item.description: In founding Capital Tea, Janel Diaz sought to provide the kind of services that she had needed after her transition.
item.content:encoded: In founding Capital Tea, Janel Diaz sought to provide the kind of services that she had needed after her transition.
item.dc:creator: Regan McCarthy

item.title: Las Vegas' famed Tropicana resort will close this week to make way for a new ballpark
item.description: When the Tropicana opened in 1957, it was the "Tiffany of the Strip," complete with showgirl revues, mob deals and James Bond. It will be demolished in October to build a new home for the Oakland A's.
item.content:encoded:
When the Tropicana opened in 1957, it was the "Tiffany of the Strip," complete with showgirl revues, mob deals and James Bond. It will be demolished in October to build a new home for the Oakland A's.

(Image credit: Ethan Miller)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Pope overcomes health concerns to preside over blustery Easter Sunday Mass
item.description: Pope Francis overcame concerns about his health to preside over Easter Sunday Mass, leading tens of thousands of people in a flower-decked St. Peter's Square.
item.content:encoded:
Pope Francis overcame concerns about his health to preside over Easter Sunday Mass, leading tens of thousands of people in a flower-decked St. Peter's Square.

(Image credit: Andrew Medichini)

item.title: Former U.S. Rep. William Delahunt of Massachusetts has died at age 82
item.description: Longtime U.S. Rep. William D. Delahunt of Massachusetts, a Democratic stalwart, has died following a long-term illness, his family announced.
item.content:encoded:
Longtime U.S. Rep. William D. Delahunt of Massachusetts, a Democratic stalwart, has died following a long-term illness, his family announced.

(Image credit: Steven Senne)

item.title: Government agents raid Peruvian President Boluarte's residence
item.description: Peruvian president Dina Boluarte is being investigated for allegedly acquiring an undisclosed collection of luxury watches since becoming vice president in 2021, and then president in 2022.
item.content:encoded:
Peruvian president Dina Boluarte is being investigated for allegedly acquiring an undisclosed collection of luxury watches since becoming vice president in 2021, and then president in 2022.

(Image credit: Martin Mejia)

item.title: Powerball jackpot jumps to $975 million after another drawing without a big winner
item.description: The Powerball jackpot climbed to an estimated $975 million after no one matched the six numbers drawn Saturday night, continuing a nearly three-month stretch without a big winner.
item.content:encoded:
The Powerball jackpot climbed to an estimated $975 million after no one matched the six numbers drawn Saturday night, continuing a nearly three-month stretch without a big winner.

(Image credit: Charles Krupa)

item.title: 8 decades later, remains of a Virginia sailor killed in Pearl Harbor are identified
item.description: David Walker from Norfolk, Va., was 19 years old when Japanese torpedoes sunk his battleship, the USS California, during the surprise attack on the Hawaii naval base in 1941.
item.content:encoded: David Walker from Norfolk, Va., was 19 years old when Japanese torpedoes sunk his battleship, the USS California, during the surprise attack on the Hawaii naval base in 1941.
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Millions of customers' data found on dark web in latest AT&T data breach
item.description: The provider says it has reset the passcodes of the current account holders whose data was compromised as it investigates the leak, the latest in a string of telecommunications company data breaches.
item.content:encoded:
The provider says it has reset the passcodes of the current account holders whose data was compromised as it investigates the leak, the latest in a string of telecommunications company data breaches.

(Image credit: Richard Drew)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Sikhs in California vote on independence from India
item.description: Sikhs in California will vote in a referendum to push for their own independent state in India
item.content:encoded: Sikhs in California will vote in a referendum to push for their own independent state in India
item.dc:creator: Sandhya Dirks

item.title: California fast-food workers will get $20 minimum wage, starting Monday
item.description: Debate is hot about the impact of a higher minimum wage. Half a million Californians work in fast-food, where wages had stagnated for decades. Restaurant owners warn of higher prices and fewer hours.
item.content:encoded:
Debate is hot about the impact of a higher minimum wage. Half a million Californians work in fast-food, where wages had stagnated for decades. Restaurant owners warn of higher prices and fewer hours.

(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes)
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Romo
